p: Eleven (61.1%) of these patients still required inhaled corticosteroids. Ten patients (55.6%) remained on oral azithromycin for its immunomodulatory benefits. The total PC-QOL mean score was 3.93 ± 0.36. One third (n = 7) had low PC-QOL scores (PC-QOL score < 4) indicating reduction in quality of life. Mean scores for each domain ranged between 3.17 (SD 2.13) - 4.48 (SD 2.37) indicating that parents were “some of the time”—“quite often” disturbed by their children’s cough.
